text:
Piers Morgan brands Ewan McGregor a ‘hypocrite’ and a ‘narrow-minded little twerp’ as he calls for boycott of films 
Morgan hit out at McGregor's work with director Roman Polanski Tuesday 24 January 2017 16:30 BST Click to followES Entertainment Scathing attack: Piers Morgan has hit out at Ewan McGregor Ken McKay/ITV/Rex 
Piers Morgan has continued his attacks on Ewan McGregor by calling for a boycott of his films after the actor pulled out of appearing on Good Morning Britain . 
McGregor, 45, was scheduled to promote his latest film T2 Trainspotting on the ITV breakfast show, but dropped out after Morgan made some controversial comments about the Women’s March on Saturday. 
Morgan scolded the actor for letting down his fans and for refusing to engage in a debate with someone who held a different viewpoint. 
Writing in his Mail Online column he said: “By refusing to be interviewed by me simply because I have a different opinion about a political march, McGregor revealed himself to be a narrow-minded, stupendously self-aggrandising, anti-democratic little twerp. 
“Perhaps everyone who voted Trump or Brexit should now boycott his movies?” 
He went on to brand McGregor a “hypocrite” for chastising his views on the Women’s March, when McGregor has worked with director Roman Polanski. Piers Morgan annoyed as Ewan Mcgregor refuses to show for GMB 
Morgan wrote: “Had we done the interview, I might have asked him how his heroic support for women justified him working for director Roman Polanski, a self-confessed and convicted child abuser, on the film, The Ghostwriter. 
“Polanksi pleaded guilty to the statutory rape of a 13-year-old girl, then fled America to escape a lengthy prison sentence. 
“‘He’s a legendary filmmaker, one of the best,’ gushed McGregor in a 2010 interview about the pedophile, for whom Meryl Streep once gave a standing ovation at the Oscars. Women's March London 2017

“A new warrant was issued for Polanski’s arrest during the movie’s post-production stage. 
“McGregor, whose has four young daughters, was asked about it and said: ‘I felt sad for Roman because he’s an old man who I’m incredibly fond of. I like him as a man.’” 
McGregor has yet to respond to Morgan’s comments. Was going on Good Morning Britain, didn't realise @piersmorgan was host. Won't go on with him after his comments about #WomensMarch — Ewan McGregor (@mcgregor_ewan) January 24, 2017 
Morgan said McGregor – who tweeted his refusal to take part in the interview – will now think he is “hugely popular”, but has in reality “anger[ed] and upset half [the] audience who don’t agree with [him]”. 
He wrote: “As soon as McGregor posted his tweet this morning, social media erupted. The luvvie lemmings, naturally, all raced to offer him their support. But many other people didn’t, and questioned why if he felt this strongly he didn’t argue the issue with me on air rather than running away? Read more
